intro: Xylosalsola chiwensis, commonly known as the Chiwan Desertweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces numerous tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Xylosalsola chiwensis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is of interest for its potential in xerophytic landscaping.
